data.title: James Poe Obituary

data.text:
James W. Poe OBITUARY

James W. Poe Resident of Brentwood James W. Poe lost his courageous battle to cancer on April 17, 2008. Born in Garrettsville, Ohio in 1920. After graduation from Ashland University, he served in WWII as a highly decorated Captain in the 10th Armored Division under General Patton. He and his family resided in Elyria, Ohio for thirty five years and was a long time member of the First Congregational Church. He was employed by Prentice-Hall Publishing as Sales Manager in the college division for thirty eight years. He & his wife retired to the Bay Area in northern California. James enjoyed frequent family vacations, was an avid golfer and a loyal fan of the Ohio State Buckeyes. He also participated in football & basketball throughout his school years, both at Rittman High and College. He will always be remembered by family & friends for his great sense of humor and his story telling ability. He is preceded in death by his two sisters, Madge Yocheim of Ashland, Ohio and Louise Tighe of Toledo, Ohio. He is survived by his wife, Portia Elaine of 60 years, a daughter Kathy Barriskill of Brentwood, Ca., a son Kevan Poe of Liberty Township, Ohio, two granddaughters Emily Heaton and Trisha Crockett and three great-grandchildren. Survived also by two sisters, Jane Gift of Louisville, Ky. and Peggy Bates of Wadsworth, Ohio. Memorial services pending. His interment is in Oakmont Memorial Park in Lafayette, Ca. Memorial donations: Sutter Hospice/Bay Area, 1900 Bates Ave., Suite A, Concord, Ca. 94520 or the Cancer Research of your choice. Funeral services were provided by Bay Area Cremation and Funeral Services. (925) 516-2710.
